Description: Green jasper(?) heart-scarab with the clypeus marked and striated elytra with the humeral callosities present; the base is inscribed with ten lines of hieroglyphic text giving Book of the Dead chapter 30 for Padiatum, a god's servant of Amun.
Curator's comments: Published: Andrews, Amulets of Ancient Egypt (1994): fig.44
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1983 Aug-Oct, Stratford, Passmore Edwards Museum, Life & Death in Ancient Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Capt Edward G Spencer-Churchill
